thread.title_full: Jio Filmfare Awards special issue : 'Udta Punjab' trio Alia Bhatt-Shahid Kapoor-Diljit Dosanjh reunite for the cover launch | Hindi Movie News - Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Jio Filmfare Awards special issue : 'Udta Punjab' trio Alia Bhatt-Shahid Kapoor-Diljit Dosanjh reunite for the cover launch | Hindi Movie News - Times of India
text:
Alia Bhatt and Shahid Kapoor graced the launch of Filmfare's new cover honouring the winners of the 62nd Jio Filmfare Awards 2017. The cover, which captures the talented stars in one frame, is definitely for keeps and Alia feels elated to be a part of it.
62nd Filmfare Awards 2017: Winners' list The host for the evening is Bollywood's baadshah, Shah Rukh Khan - needless to say, King Khan is bringing the house down with his witty one-liners.
Present at the event, Shahid Kapoor, the 'Padmavati' actor took a jibe at his close friend Alia saying, "This is a long term relationship Alia has with success and with being a phenomenal actor." To which Alia politely replied, "As you can see Shahid has decided to trouble me today so it's okay. It is one of those days." The duo unveiled the Filmfare cover in the presence of Diljit Dosanjh , to a harmonious background score of a bugle.
The actors further went on to pose for pictures and click selfies with their fans present at the venue.
While the 'Udta Punjab' trio of Shahid Kapoor (Best Actor: Critics' Choice), Diljit Dosanjh (Best Male Debut) and Alia Bhatt (Best Actress) dominate the left of the Filmfare Awards Special cover, veterans Shabana Azmi (Best Supporting Actress) and Rishi Kapoor (Best Supporting Actor) also find a spot on it along with Shatrughan Sinha who was honoured with the Filmfare Lifetime Achievement Award this year.
Manoj Bajpayee calls for attention at the centre of the cover, he won many a hears as well as the Filmfare Best Actor: Critics' Choice Award of the year. Nitesh Tiwari registers his presence as the winner of the Best Director Award for 'Dangal'. The lesser known face, Ritika Singh who grabbed the Best Female Debut for the R Madhavan starrer 'Saala Khadoos' also features on the cover.
Mira shuts down critics who called her chemistry with Shahid ‘acting’ 02:05
